glsa.title: Nagios: Buffer overflow
glsa.synopsis: Nagios is vulnerable to a buffer overflow which may lead to remote execution of arbitrary code.

background.p: Nagios is an open source host, service and network monitoring program.

description.p: Sebastian Krahmer of the SuSE security team discovered a buffer overflow vulnerability in the handling of a negative HTTP Content-Length header.

impact.p: A buffer overflow in Nagios CGI scripts under certain web servers allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a negative content length HTTP header.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All Nagios users should upgrade to the latest version:
